description:
Data from the 2022 Census released today by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE) shows a significant drop in the country’s illiteracy rate: from 9.6 percent of Brazilians over 15 years old in 2010, to 7 percent in 2022. By literate, the research considers those who can read and write a simple note. […]

The post Illiteracy falls in Brazil, but still runs along racial lines appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Illiteracy falls in Brazil, but still runs along racial lines

description:
The Federal Prosecution Office said the investigation into a coup attempt led by former far-right President Jair Bolsonaro is “nearing completion,” according to a document leaked to news website G1. Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes on Thursday released on bail retired Army Colonel Marcelo Câmara, a former aide to Mr. Bolsonaro. Col. Câmara had […]

The post Coup attempt investigation in its final stages appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Coup attempt investigation in its final stages
